page.title: 13BISHOP BURTON TRANSPORT
page.content: The busy main road between York and Hull, the{A1079,}with its heavy traffic, passes through the middle of Bishop Burton village and skirts the village's main pond. But providing a bypass for the village has been given low priority by the County Council. About 70% of villagers have cars. There is{one bus service (746) between {Hull and Leeds}which passes through the village. It runs approximately every two hours which is inconvenient for people who do not possess a car but have to commute to work, but does give old age pensioners some mobility. There is some resentment by newcomers to the village, who are unused to rural life, to farmers' slurry tankers, trailers, tractors and livestock lorries going through the village and delaying traffic.
